destinationDescription: Australia is one of the top destinations for international students. It is famous for its diverse cultures and high-quality education. Some of the world’s leading universities are in Australia, and they provide world-class opportunities for research, innovation, and careers. With globally recognized degrees and English as the medium of instruction, international students can immerse themselves in a global environment.
whyStudyDescription: Australian universities are renowned for their academic excellence, and their programs are designed to be practical, preparing students for global careers. Australia is a multicultural society where international students can feel safe and foster a sense of belonging. The Australian government offers post-study work visas to students.
quickFacts: Australia hosted approximately 360,000–380,000 international students.
Australia ranks 3rd globally in hosting international students (after the United States and the United Kingdom).
About 15–20% of international graduates secure leadership positions within five years of graduation.
International students contribute approximately AUD $37–40 billion annually to the Australian economy.

Australia is one of the most unique countries in the world—not only geographically but also culturally. International students are warmly welcomed and might be surprised by: Australians’ direct and straightforward communication style.Their laid-back and casual attitude to life.
 Their love for dry, self-deprecating jokes.

Their passion for the outdoors, often walking barefoot and enjoying activities like exploring the Great Barrier Reef and national parks.
 Australia also respects and celebrates Indigenous Australian culture.

destinationDescription: Here’s a comprehensive guide for all students who want to study in Switzerland
whyStudyDescription: Switzerland is often called heaven on earth. This landlocked mountainous country is not only a tourist destination but also offers great opportunities in Higher Study. Their universities have a long tradition of  scientific endeavour. The Universities of Switzerlands has produced 28 Nobel laureates; even Albert Einstein did most of his research while living in Switzerland. Switzerland is the world leader in Physics, Chemistry, Biotechnology, and Materials Science. Graduates from Swiss universities make a global impact. Swiss universities have an open and multicultural learning environment. As they work with the latest technology their graduates are able to make a practical impact in innovation and leadership. Studying in Switzerland could be your best decision in life.
quickFacts: Switzerland is consistently among the top countries for R&D and is ranked in the top 15 globally.
Swiss cities like Zurich, Geneva, and Lausanne are recognized as prominent student destinations and frequently appear in rankings like the QS Best Student Cities list.
Switzerland has 12 universities of international reputation.
Switzerland attracts over 50,000 international students annually.
Admission to Swiss universities without IELTS is possible under certain conditions.

destinationDescription: Here’s a comprehensive guide for all students who want to study in the Germany.
whyStudyDescription: Germany is a popular destination for international students. It is a top-five country where international students go to seek higher studies. The German education system has worldwide recognition. The  educational expenses are affordable, even free in public universities plus the living cost is manageable.The country has many top-ranked universities. Graduates from German universities  are recognized worldwide. The country and its universities are known for producing many Nobel Prize winners. Another benefit is that students do not have to know German for studying, as many universities provide courses in English. Along with an 18-month post-study work permit, the country allows international students to work up to 20 hours per week. The country is diverse in culture. Along with its strong economy, it is a safe country to build a prosperous future.
quickFacts: Research and innovation are the backbone of the German educational system. It has 57 Clusters of Excellence funded at 34 universities across Germany.
Several German universities consistently rank among the top 100 globally.
Germany ranks 3rd globally in scientific publications, producing approximately 8–10% of the world's scientific research outputs.
German universities and research institutions file numerous patents annually.
One of the unique aspects of German higher education is the Dual Study Programmes. Equal focus is given to theoretical and practical learning.
Education in Germany is free in all public schools and universities, whereas private universities only charge a minimal amount compared to other countries.
Germany is a multicultural society that embraces diversity so international student can cope there easily.

application.description: To apply for a Germanian study visa, you'll need to provide the following documents:
list: Passport: Must have a validity of at least 12 months
1 Recent Biometric Passport Photograph : Photographs must not be older than six months

Visa Application Forms: Ensure that both forms are completely filled out and signed. Include your future residence address in Germany. Provide your complete home address, including your telephone number and email address in Bangladesh.
Copy of Your Passport’s Data Page: Must be an A4-sized copy
Declaration of Consent: Signed and dated
Proof of Admission: Proof of admission to the relevant university or institution should be included. Additionally, include scholarship certificates if applicable.

Language Proficiency:For English-speaking programs, proof of English language knowledge (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS) is required, unless you have completed a Bachelor’s degree in Australia, the UK, or the US. For German-speaking programs, proof of German language knowledge is needed, with a “Zertifikat B1” and a ‘good’ result or higher being recommended
Higher Secondary Education Board Certificate and Mark Sheets
Proof of Previous Studies : Include Bachelor’s degree and transcripts, if applicable

Medical Insurance :  Provide incoming medical insurance or proof of public/private insurance. This must be submitted at the time of visa approval, and more information will be provided during the interview

Proof of Financial Means : Submit one of the following documents to cover the costs of your studies: Confirmation of Scholarship/Stipend, a Formal Sponsorship Letter from a sponsor living in Germany (“Verpflichtungserklärung” as per Art. 68 of the German Residence Act for Studies), or a Blocked Account (“Sperrkonto”) in Germany with a minimum balance of €11,904. The Blocked Account must include a remark that the account holder can withdraw a monthly amount of €992 for 12 months (including bank handling fees)

Motivation Letter : State why you are interested in studying the program and mention what you did during the waiting period between your studies and this application, if applicable. The letter must be signed by you.
Curriculum Vitae (CV) :Include a detailed CV mentioning your educational background, jobs, and other relevant experiences

destinationDescription: The United States is a top destination for students worldwide, offering world-class education, abundant work opportunities, and a high standard of living. Known as the land of opportunity, the USA provides a pathway to career success and a bright future. Home to many of the world’s leading universities, it’s an ideal choice for higher studies abroad.
whyStudyDescription: The country offers diverse educational opportunities that cover a wide range of programs and courses across various fields. The USA, often called a melting pot of culture attracts people from all over the world to live there. Therefore, studying in the U.S. can provide excellent exposure to different cultures and perspectives. The world-class research facilities, innovative programs, and modern teaching methods are some of the best benefits you can gain by studying in the USA. Along with your studies, you will have ample opportunities for internships, research projects, and industry connections, helping you gain real-world skills alongside your academic degrees.
quickFacts: Studying in the USA provides an excellent experience for international students to explore unique American culture and customs.
Students may enjoy the practice of individualism, where independence and self-reliance are highly valued.
Open communication and directness are other cultural aspects that are appreciated.
Punctuality is important but not as rigid as in cultures like Germany or Japan.
Americans value a balance of social and academic settings.
Many universities offer extended programs like American football, basketball, baseball, and ice hockey.
Vibrant music festivals like Coachella and Bonnaroo are part of the culture, as well as opportunities for thousands of miles-long road trips.
Students can join clubs and organizations, attend campus events, volunteer, and explore different regions of the United States to fully immerse themselves in American culture.
Over 25% of the world’s top 100 universities are in the USA.
Post-study stay back visas (OPT) up to 3 years for STEM programs
Internships (CPT) up to 12 months while studying.
Over 4,500 accredited universities & institutions to choose from.
12 of the best student cities in the world (QS Best Student Cities 2023).
Opportunities for Research, Teaching & Graduate Assistantships.

faq.question: What is the visa process like for international students in the USA?
faq.answer: International students need an F-1 visa to study in the USA, which involves filling out an application form, providing required documents, and attending an interview at a US consulate or embassy.

faq.question: Can I work part-time while studying in the USA?
faq.answer: International students can work part-time on-campus for up to 20 hours per week during the academic year, and during breaks, they can work full-time. Popular universities for international students include Harvard and Columbia.

faq.question: Some of the top-ranked universities in the USA?

faq.question: What is the cost of living in the USA for international students?
faq.answer: Living expenses vary by city and lifestyle, with major cities like New York and Boston being more expensive.

faq.question: What are the cultural differences I should be aware of when studying in the USA?
faq.answer: The US is a multicultural nation, requiring open-mindedness and respect for diverse customs, traditions, and social norms to navigate its diverse landscape.

faq.question: What are the career opportunities for international students after studying in the USA?
faq.answer: VA US degree can open doors to the US and international career. Many universities offer career services to help students find jobs and internships.

faq.question: What is the best time to apply for US universities?
faq.answer: The fall is the optimal time to apply for US universities, with deadlines typically in December or January.

documents.description: The Canadian Government provides an opportunity to Bangladeshi students to study in the country but as a prerequisite, you’ll have to obtain a Study Permit and a Temporary Resident Visa (TRV). What is a study permit? This is not a visa, it’s a permit or a document issued by the Citizen and Immigration (CIC) which allows you to Study in Canada. If you hold a study permit, you must remain enrolled and make reasonable and timely progress towards completing your course. Your study permit is always accompanied along by a visitor visa or Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA). Please note that a study permit is a document that allows you to study in Canada while a visitor visa or ETA allows you to enter Canada. Your counsellor will help you access the latest information and connect you with authorized migration experts.Documents required for your study permit To apply for your study permit, you will need:
list: An acceptance letter from your education institution
A valid passport or travel document
Proof that you can support yourself or any family members who might accompany you while you’re in Canada
Letter of acceptance: From a Designated Learning Institution (DLI)
Check the minimum funds that need to be reflected in your bank account as an international student

statement.description: The Statement of Purpose (SOP) is a crucial document for students who want to study abroad. It is typically 1000–1200 words long and serves as an essay that showcases your identity and outlines the value you will bring to the university. It is important to follow a specific format and stick to the word limit to create an impressive SOP. If you need detailed guidance on how to structure a compelling Statement of Purpose, you can seek assistance from Shabuj Global Educations's counselors.

application.description: To apply for a Canadian study visa, you'll need to provide the following documents:
list: Passport: A valid passport that covers the length of your intended stay in Canada
Statement of Purpose (SOP): A written statement that explains your academic background, career goals, and reasons for choosing Canada
Passport-sized photographs: Two photographs that meet the required criteria if you're applying by mail, or a digital copy if you're applying online
Letter of acceptance: From a Designated Learning Institution (DLI)
Proof of financial support: Also known as proof of funds, this document shows that you have enough money to cover your first year of tuition and live in Canada

faq.question: How much does it cost to study in Canada?
faq.answer: Studying in Canada: Universities costs range from an average of CA$25,000 - CA$35,000 per year for international students.

faq.question: What qualification is required to study in Canada?
faq.answer: Qualifications: A high school diploma for undergraduate; a bachelor's degree for postgraduate and proficiency in English or French.

faq.question: What is the fastest way to get PR in Canada?
faq.answer: Fastest PR path: Express Entry, especially if one qualifies for Canadian Experience Class after studying/working in Canada.

faq.question: Can I study in Canada and get a job?
faq.answer: Yes, many international students find jobs in Canada post-graduation.

faq.question: Can I get PR after 1 year of study in Canada?
faq.answer: No, but studying in Canada can make it easier to qualify for PR through pathways like the Canadian Experience Class.
